member.name: T:Cake.Powershell.ArrayArgument
member.summary: Represents a comma separated array of arguments.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The arguments that will be comma separated.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.ArrayArgument.Render
member.summary: Render the arguments as a . Sensitive information will be included.
member.returns: A comma separated string representation of the arguments.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.ArrayArgument.RenderSafe
member.summary: Renders the argument as a . Sensitive information will be redacted.
member.returns: A comma separated safe string representation of the argument.

member.summary: Renders the argument as a . Sensitive information will be redacted.

member.name: T:Cake.Powershell.StringLiteralArgument
member.summary: Represents a string-literal argument. Specifically, '$' chars will not be evaulated as variables, nor will '()' pairs as expressions.

member.summary: Renders the argument as a string-literal . Sensitive information will be redacted.
member.returns: A safe string representation of the argument.

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.summary: Adds the specified module to load into the initial state

member.summary: Sets the working directory for the process to be started.

member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.summary: Sets the optional timeout for powershell command
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettingsExtensions.UseComputerName(Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettings,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the computer name to connect to
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.summary: Sets the remote port to connect on.

member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettingsExtensions.UseUsername(Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettings,System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the credentials to use when connecting
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettingsExtensions.UsePassword(Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettings,System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the credentials to use when connecting
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettingsExtensions.SetFormatOutput(Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettings,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the output of an application should be formatted as text
member.param: true if output should be written to the cake console; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettingsExtensions.SetLogOutput(Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettings,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the output of an application is written to the cake console
member.param: true if output should be written to the cake console; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettingsExtensions.OutputToAppConsole(Cake.Powershell.PowershellSettings,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the output of an application is written to its on-screen console.
member.param: true if output should be written to the app's on-screen console; otherwsie, false. The default is true.
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: T:Cake.Powershell.SecureExtensions
member.summary: Extensions methods for creating secure strings

member.summary: Creates a secure string for storing powershell passwords
member.returns: The secure string.

member.name: T:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface
member.summary: An implementation of that is used when an app has no console for output.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.BackgroundColor
member.summary: There is no console, so a ConsoleColor of black is returned.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.BufferSize
member.summary: There is no console, so buffer size of 300x5000 is returned to prevent crashes.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.CursorPosition
member.summary: There is no console, so an empty Coordinates instance is returned.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.CursorSize
member.summary: There is no console, so a cursor size of 1 is returned.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.ForegroundColor
member.summary: There is no console, so a ConsoleColor of white is returned.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.KeyAvailable
member.summary: There is no color, so false is returned to indicate no key was pressed.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.MaxPhysicalWindowSize
member.summary: There is no console, so the value of is returned.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.MaxWindowSize
member.summary: There is no console, so the value of is returned.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.WindowPosition
member.summary: There is no console, so empty Coordinates are returned.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.WindowSize
member.summary: There is no console, so the value of is returned.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.WindowTitle
member.summary: There is no console, so an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.ReadKey(System.Management.Automation.Host.ReadKeyOptions)
member.summary: There is no console, so this is not implemented.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.GetBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle)
member.summary: There is no console, so this is not implemented.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.FlushInputBuffer
member.summary: There is no console, does nothing

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.SetBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Coordinates,System.Management.Automation.Host.BufferCell[0:,0:])
member.summary: There is no console, does nothing

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.SetBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle,System.Management.Automation.Host.BufferCell)
member.summary: There is no console, does nothing

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostNoConsoleRawUserInterface.ScrollBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle,System.Management.Automation.Host.Coordinates,System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle,System.Management.Automation.Host.BufferCell)
member.summary: There is no console, does nothing

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the displayed text. This maps to the corresponding Console.Background property.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.BufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the host buffer. In this example the buffer size is adapted from the Console buffer size members.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.CursorPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor position. In this example this functionality is not needed so the property throws a NotImplementException exception.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.CursorSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the displayed cursor. In this example the cursor size is taken directly from the Console.CursorSize property.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.ForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the displayed text. This maps to the corresponding Console.ForgroundColor property.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.KeyAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user has pressed a key. This maps to the corresponding Console.KeyAvailable property.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.MaxPhysicalWindowSize
member.summary: Gets the dimensions of the largest window that could be rendered in the current display, if the buffer was at the least that large. This example uses the Console.LargestWindowWidth and Console.LargestWindowHeight properties to determine the returned value of this property.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.MaxWindowSize
member.summary: Gets the dimentions of the largest window size that can be displayed. This example uses the Console.LargestWindowWidth and console.LargestWindowHeight properties to determine the returned value of this property.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.WindowPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the displayed window. This example uses the Console window position APIs to determine the returned value of this property.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.WindowSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the displayed window. This example uses the corresponding Console window size APIs to determine the returned value of this property.

member.name: P:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.WindowTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the displayed window. The example maps the Console.Title property to the value of this property.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.FlushInputBuffer
member.summary: This API resets the input buffer. In this example this functionality is not needed so the method returns nothing.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.GetBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle)
member.summary: This API returns a rectangular region of the screen buffer. In this example this functionality is not needed so the method throws a NotImplementException exception.
member.param: Defines the size of the rectangle.
member.returns: Throws a NotImplementedException exception.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.ReadKey(System.Management.Automation.Host.ReadKeyOptions)
member.summary: This API reads a pressed, released, or pressed and released keystroke from the keyboard device, blocking processing until a keystroke is typed that matches the specified keystroke options. In this example this functionality is not needed so the method throws a NotImplementException exception.
member.param: Options, such as IncludeKeyDown, used when reading the keyboard.
member.returns: Throws a NotImplementedException exception.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.ScrollBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle,System.Management.Automation.Host.Coordinates,System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle,System.Management.Automation.Host.BufferCell)
member.summary: This API crops a region of the screen buffer. In this example this functionality is not needed so the method throws a NotImplementException exception.
member.param: The region of the screen to be scrolled.
The region of the screen to receive the source region contents.
The region of the screen to include in the operation.
The character and attributes to be used to fill all cell.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.SetBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Coordinates,System.Management.Automation.Host.BufferCell[0:,0:])
member.summary: This method copies an array of buffer cells into the screen buffer at a specified location. In this example this functionality is not needed so the method throws a NotImplementedException exception.

member.name: M:Cake.Powershell.CakePSHostRawUserInterface.SetBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle,System.Management.Automation.Host.BufferCell)
member.summary: This method copies a given character, foreground color, and background color to a region of the screen buffer. In this example this functionality is not needed so the method throws a NotImplementException exception.///
member.param: Defines the area to be filled.
